moves.1. e4 d6 2. d4 Nf6 3. Bd3 e5 4. c3 d5: 4 d5!? is tactically possible because of white's pawn moves.
moves.5. exd5 exd4 6. Bb5+ Bd7 7. Bxd7+ Qxd7 8: Black has a very slight initiative here.
This move, 13 ...f6!? is designed to free d8 for play on the d-file, and to deny white g5 and e5.
moves.16... Nf4 17. Bg3: Bg3? is a miscalculation.  Rad1 was the best move.
moves.17... Nd3: Of course. A Knight on the 6th is a bone in the throat...
moves.20... Nxd4 21. Nxd4 Rxb2 22. Rxb2 Nxb2 2: White plans to recover the pawn, since if ...c6, Nd6!. But...
moves.23... Na4 24. Bxc7 Bxc7 25. Nxc7 Nxc3: White has simplified into a lost ending
moves.26. a3 Kf7: Now White's Knight can't escape. White's only hope is to go after the Black Knight.
moves.27. Kf1 Ke7 28. Ke1 Kd7 29. Kd2 Ne4+: This move assures White a pawn majority on hoth sides of the board.
moves.30. Ke3 Nxf2: White's position is hopeless, and he resigns.
